description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b4a1d","text":"These steps represent a starting point for analysis of lipidomics data. Other data analysis and/or packages may be used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"arjll","text":"Tsugawa H, Cajka T, Kind T, Ma Y, Higgins B, Ikeda K, Kanazawa M, VanderGheynst J, Fiehn O, Arita M. MS-DIAL: data-independent MS/MS deconvolution for comprehensive metabolome analysis. Nat Methods. 2015 Jun;12(6):523-6. doi: 10.1038/nmeth.3393. Epub 2015 May 4. PMID: 25938372; PMCID: PMC4449330.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpml9","text":"Tsugawa, H., Ikeda, K., Takahashi, M. et al. A lipidome atlas in MS-DIAL 4. Nat Biotechnol 38, 1159–1163 (2020). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41587-020-0531-2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pein","text":"\nPang, Z., Lu, Y., Zhou, G., Hui, F., Xu, L., Viau, C., Spigelman, A., MacDonald, P., Wishart, D., Li, S., and Xia, J. (2024) MetaboAnalyst 6.0: towards a unified platform for metabolomics data processing, analysis and interpretation Nucleic Acids Research (doi: 10.1093/nar/gkae253)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":126,"length":107},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":234,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":126,"length":107}],"data":{}},{"key":"f0e59","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D104E87E2D7811EFB4BA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkae253"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ak8jq","text":"Thermo RAW files are organized in two folders - one for all positive mode raw files and another for all negative mode raw files. These files will be loaded into MS-DIAL in two separate searches. Download MSP library files for Positive and Negative mode and save them in a folder in the computer you are using to perform the searches.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1k55e","text":"Project file path: Browse the folder with Positive or Negative raw files
Ionization type: Soft ionization (LC-MSMS)
Separation type: Chromatography (LC)
MS method type: Conventional LC/MS or data dependent MS/MS
Data type: MS1 Profile, MS/MS Centroid
Ion mode: Positive or Negative
Target omics: Lipidomics
Click "Next"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2vnkr","text":"Analysis file path: browse to the folder with raw files, select all the apply for the search. Should include at least 3 blanks and 3 QC runs.\nChoose the file type for each sample (Blank, QC, sample)\nClass ID - add short group names for each replicate without adding numbers among replicates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cs7rc","text":"Data collection tab ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as0od","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d44kh","text":"Mass accuracy: MS1 tolerance 0.01 Da, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1o4u","text":"MS2 tolerance 0.025 Da","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tqad","text":"- Advanced: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33m18","text":"Data collection parameters: retention time begin 0 min, retention time end 33 min, MS1 range begin 150 Da, MS1 range end 2000 Da, MSMS range begin 150 Da, MSMS range end 2000 Da, Isotope recognition: max charge number 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3k5f","text":"Peak Detection tab ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs40m","text":"Peak detection parameters: minimum peak height 10000 amplitude, mass slice 0.1 Da","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"53s5c","text":"- Advanced:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ihsv","text":"Smoothing method: linear weighted moving average","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9kjr","text":"Smoothing level: 3 scan ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1kif","text":"Minimum peak width: 5 scan","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dt77n","text":"MS2Dec tab ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"88kc3","text":"Deconvolution parameters: sigma window value 0.5, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqo50","text":"MS2 abundance cut off 10 amplitude. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qfkf","text":"- Advanced: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67o77","text":"Check Exclude after precursor ion Keep the isotope ions until 0.5 Da ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpn53","text":"Check Keep the isotopic ions w/o MS2Dec","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"20c55","text":"Identification tab
MSP file and MS/MS identification setting: the library will be loaded automatically
Retention time tolerance: 100 min, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i80t","text":"Accurate mass tolerance (MS1) 0.01  Da, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7j5d","text":"Accurate mass tolerance MS/MS 0.05, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnuqh","text":"Identification score cut off 80%.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"a0u64","text":"Alignment tab
Alignment parameters settings: Under result name add a name for the alignment file, reference file choose one of the QC runs, retention time tolerance 0.05 min, MS1 tolerance 0.015 Da
- Advanced:
Check remove feature based on blank information
Check keep "reference matched" metabolite features
Check keep ''suggested (w/o MS2)" metabolite features
Check keep removable features and assign the tag
Check Gap filling by compulsion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"djp3o","text":"At the bottom
Check together with Alignment 
Click "Finish" --> processing will start.
Once the search is finished, click on the name of the file that is showing at the Alignment Navigator
Click Export - Alignment result, choose a folder to save the file, check remove features from blank, and export.
Data can be loaded into Excel/R or any other software environment for further data analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8orc6","text":"Data Analysis:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctema","text":"load data into Excel, filter out: m/z match FALSE and identifications named w/o MS2. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0sh5","text":"Combine positive and negative identifications","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am2pn","text":"Summarize the data by lipid name (ex: using R), save as txt file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alpu5","text":"Load the summarized into R or the online MetaboAnalyst 6.0 tool. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Analysis parameter setting - keep default if not mentioned in this section
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"44ocp","text":"
MetaboAnalyst 6.0 --> statistical analysis
Upload .txt data as peak intensities (check file format), no data filtering, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"678sr","text":"Sample normalization: normalization by median, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99a62","text":"Data transformation: Log transformation (base 10), no Data Scaling. 
At this point there are distinct analyses that can be done, our core provides the following as a first-step analysis:
Chemometrics analysis: PCA, PLS-DA with importance measures using VIP.
Univariate analysis: fold change and t-test -> volcano plot (two groups comparisons).
Clustering analysis: heatmap.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
